snippet: New federal guidelines have reduced the food minimums for this school year, but some meals for students still require more calories than New York City schools have been providing.
abstract: New York City officials acknowledge that some school cafeterias went too far in cutting fat, ending up serving children meals with fewer calories than are required by the US Agriculture Dept; Education Dept is busy fine-tuning menus to meet federal nutritional standards for the current school year.
lead_paragraph: New federal guidelines have reduced the food minimums for this school year, but some meals for students still require more calories than New York City schools have been providing.

headline.seo: Calories in Some N.Y.C. School Lunches Were Below Federal Requirements
headline.main: Lunch Trays Got Too Lean in City’s Fight Against Fat
headline.print_headline: Lunch Trays Got Too Lean In City Fight Against Fat
